RGS Ecosystem

Gamified AI-based rehabilitation for motor and cognitive therapy

Eodyne

Unity Developer

About the Project

Eodyne builds science-based neurorehabilitation tools that help people recover motor, cognitive and pain-related functions after brain damage. Its main product, the Rehabilitation Gaming System (RGS), uses AI together with virtual and augmented reality, sensors and cloud services to offer personalized therapy that can be used in hospitals, clinics and at home.

The RGS ecosystem runs on everyday technology like VR headsets, mobile devices, desktop apps and motion-capture systems, turning them into immersive rehab tools that can adapt to different healthcare environments and patient needs.

My Contributions

In my role as a Senior Unity Developer, I helped amplify the tech team’s impact across mobile, web and VR solutions.

RGSApp Architecture & Game Development

Led the development of the RGSApp environment and architecture, as well as several of the rehabilitation games included in the system.

Mentorship & Best Practices

Mentored team members on Unity best practices and established coding standards to improve code quality.

Performance Optimization

Tackled key optimization challenges on mobile, desktop and VR to deliver smooth and reliable rehabilitation experiences.

Development Tools

Crafted custom development tools to facilitate a more agile and efficient development process.
